Translations views¶

The views for the translations app.

This will be the only interface that consumers of this service will communicate with.

The purpose of this will be to act as a bridge between the decyphr application and the Google Translate API. Incoming text will be deserialized, translated and returned back the cosumer that will ultimately be returned to an end user.

class translations.views.PlainTextTranslator(**kwargs)[source]¶

The translation endpoint that will be used to translate basic text into a target specified target language

create(request)[source]¶

The endpoint that will take the incoming data and language code and send it to Google to be translated. The response will come back from Google and it will be return the client

Parameters:
  • language_code (str) – A ISO 639-1 code that will be used to inform Google Translate of the target language
  • text (str) – The text that is needed to be translated
Returns:

language_code (str): A ISO 639-1 code of the target language text (str): The text that is needed to be translated translated_text (str): The translated text
Return type:

JSON

Example

curl -X POST -H ‘Content-type: application/json’ http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/v1/plain-text/ -d ‘{“language_code”: “en”, “text”: “oi”}’

serializer_class¶

alias of translations.serializers.PlainTextTranslationSerializer

Translations Google Wrapper¶

The Google wrapper class is a mixin that will be used in all of the endpoints relating to the interaction with Google Cloud services.

class translations.google_wrapper.GoogleMixin[source]¶

Google Cloud Mixin Class

This mixin will contain all of the necessary functionality required to integrate with the relevant Google Cloud services.

Examples

In order to take advantage of this mixin, simple extended it::
class TranslationEndpoint(viewsets.ViewSet, GoogleMixin):
translate_text(target_language_code, text)[source]¶

Translate Text

The interface into Google’s Translation API.

Parameters:
  • target_language_code – A ISO 639-1 code that will be used to inform Google Translate of the target language
  • text (str) – The text that is needed to be translated
Returns:

The text that was returned by the Google Translate API
Return type:

Tranlated text (str)

Examples

translated_text = self.translate_text(language_code, text)

Translations serializers¶

Translation Serializers.

This module will contain the serializers that relate to the translation views

class translations.serializers.PlainTextTranslationSerializer(instance=None, data=<class 'rest_framework.fields.empty'>, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plain Text Translation Serializer

This serializer will be used to deserialize the incoming text and language code and once the the translation has been completed by Google Translate, the translated text will be included in the information in the response

Parameters:
  • language_code (str) – A ISO 639-1 code that will be used to inform Google Translate of the target language
  • text (str) – The text that is needed to be translated
  • translated_text (str) – The translated text will only be populated once
  • translation has been performed by Google Translate (the) –
